name: Clockhand
ability: The Storyteller's Grimoire includes a Clockhand token, placed in front of a player selected on the first night. At the start of each day (except for the first), the Clockhand proceeds one seat around the circle, clockwise.

otherNightReminder: Disclose to the Curly how many votes, in-total, were cast by non-Townsfolk today.
name: Curly
ability: Each night, you learn how many votes were cast by non-Townsfolk today.

firstNightReminder: Reveal to the Darling the character of one Outsider in play, and how many seats the Clockhand is away from that Outsider.
otherNightReminder: Reveal to the Darling how many seats the Clockhand is away from their Outsider.
name: Darling
ability: You start knowing 1 Outsider character in play. Each night, you learn how many seats the Clockhand is away from that Outsider. [Minimum 1 Outsider]

name: Liza
ability: While you are alive, the Storyteller might not collect vote tokens from dead good players who voted (after their votes have been counted.)

firstNightReminder: Wake an evil player, and inform them the Nibs is in play.
otherNightReminder: If the Nibs died tonight: reveal to them how many seats the Clockhand is away from the Demon.
name: Nibs
ability: If you die at night, you learn how many seats the Clockhand is away from the Demon. 1 evil player knows that Nibs is in play.

otherNightReminder: The Pan may point to a player: if they're good, wake that player, and ask them to select a player with whom to trade seats.
name: Pan
ability: Each night*, choose a player: if good, they may trade seats with a player of their choosing. While the Clockhand is pointing to you, you cannot die.

name: Slightly
ability: The first time you are nominated, if the nominator is not a Townsfolk, they are executed immediately.

firstNightReminder: The Tiger Lily may point to a player: if that player is not a Townsfolk, they die.
otherNightReminder: The Tiger Lily may point to a player: if that player is not a Townsfolk, they die.
name: Tiger Lily
ability: Once per game, at night, choose a player (other than yourself): if they are not a Townsfolk, they die. While you are alive, you remain healthy and sober (e.g. Tiger Lily is immune to poison.)

firstNightReminder: Indicate to the Tootles the total number of living Townsfolk in play.
otherNightReminder: Indicate the total number of living Townsfolk in play.
name: Tootles
ability: Each night, you learn how many Townsfolk are alive.

otherNightReminder: Ask the Twins to select a player: reveal to them two types, including the type of that player.
name: Twins
ability: Each night*, choose a player (different to last night): you learn that they are one of two types (Townsfolk, Outsider, Minion, Demon.)

otherNightReminder: Ask the Watchdog to indicate which player they're watching over.
name: Watchdog
ability: Each night*, select a player (other than yourself): if good, they are protected from the Demon, unless the Clockhand is pointing to them. If evil, they don't wake up tonight.

otherNightReminder: Ask if the Fairy would like to choose a character to resurrect. If they do, and that character is in play, and the player is dead, return them to life.
name: Fairy
ability: The Clockhand skips you, and proceeds to your clockwise neighbor. Once per game, at night, name a character: if they are in play, and the player is dead, they are resurrected.

otherNightReminder: The Mermaids may point to a non-neighboring player: that player trades seat with whichever neighbor moves them nearer to the Mermaids.
name: Mermaids
ability: Each night*, you may choose a player who is not one of your neighbors: they trade seats to be one seat nearer to you.

name: Rooster
ability: The first time an Outsider dies, you gain their ability. If Pan is in play, and dies, you become Pan, and gain their ability (and therefore will no longer gain an Outsider ability as Rooster.) [+1 Outsider]

firstNightReminder: Reveal to the Tick Tock if the Clockhand is pointed at them: if it is, ask if they want to stop it.
otherNightReminder: Reveal to the Tick Tock if the Clockhand is pointed at them: if it is, ask if they want to stop it.
name: Tick Tock
ability: At night, you learn if the Clockhand is pointed at you. If it is, you may choose to stop it (it will not advance tomorrow.)

otherNightReminder: Ask the Gentleman Starkey how many seats they're advancing the Clockhand, clockwise.
name: Gentleman Starkey
ability: Each night*, you may advance the Clockhand any number of seats, clockwise. If you do, it will not advance tomorrow day.

hatred.reason: If Hook and Pan are both in play, the Storyteller should randomize in which order their abilities to offer seat trades are processed.

otherNightReminder: The previously-poisoned player is no longer poisoned. The Hook may point to a player: wake that player, and ask them to select a player with whom to trade seats.
name: Hook
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they may trade seats with a player of their choosing, but might be poisoned tonight and tomorrow day if they choose to do so. The first time you are executed, you might not die.

firstNightReminder: Show 1 character token of a good player not in play that you did not show to the demon.
otherNightReminder: The previously-poisoned player is no longer poisoned. The Pirate points to a player: that player is poisoned.
name: Pirate
ability: On the first night, you learn 1 good character not in play, which is not one of the characters given to the demon as bluffs. Each night*, choose a player: they are poisoned tonight and tomorrow day.

name: Smee
ability: Even if you are dead, while you still hold your vote token, vote tokens might not be collected from any other players by the Storyteller (after their votes have been counted.)

firstNightReminder: Ask the Captain to select a starting position for the Clockhand.
otherNightReminder: Reveal to whom the Clockhand is currently pointing, and ask if the Captain would like to poison them. If they do so, the previously-poisoned player is no longer poisoned. Then, the Captain points to a player; that player dies.
name: Captain
ability: On the first night, select the starting position of the Clockhand. Each night*, learn which player the Clockhand is pointing to: you may choose to poison them. If you do so, any player you previously selected is no longer poisoned. Each night* , choose a player: they die.

firstNightReminder: Choose a good player to select a starting position for the Clockhand.
otherNightReminder: Reveal to whom the Clockhand is currently pointing, and ask if the Crocodile would like to kill them. Then, the Crocodile points to a player; that player dies. Also ask if they'd like to restore a player they killed to life.
name: Crocodile
ability: On the first night, the Storyteller chooses a good player to select the starting position of the Clockhand. Each night*, learn which player the Clockhand is pointing to: you may choose to kill them. Each night*, choose a player: they die. Once per game, you may return a player you previously killed to life.

firstNightReminder: Ask the Shadow to select a starting position for the Clockhand.
otherNightReminder: Reveal to whom the Clockhand is currently pointing, and ask if the Shadow would like them to die. Then, the Shadow points to a player; that player is now evil, and any player previously-selected by the Shadow dies.
name: Shadow
ability: On the first night, select the starting position of the Clockhand. Each night*, learn which player the Clockhand is pointing to: you may choose to kill them. Each night*, you may choose a player: they become evil, and win with the evil team. Any player you have previously selected to become evil turns good then dies.
